channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: From Jamie Dimon to Bill Ackman, Wall Street’s billionaires are now changing their tune and offering to help Zohran Mamdani
item.description: Over $22 million was spent by billionaires to prevent the democratic socialist from becoming mayor-elect, estimates say.

item.title: The best way to test the ‘Musk Magic’ premium may be to give Elon Musk everything he wants
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The only phone notifications Jamie Dimon gets are from his kids—everyone else has to call the office
item.description: "If you send me a text during the day, I probably do not read it," Dimon said.

item.title: Founders are getting huge paydays before their startups are close to an exit—and that’s fine with many VCs
item.description: Venture firms don’t like to talk about early stage secondary sales but the practice is common in bull markets.

item.title: A Skeptical Supreme Court Puts Trump’s Tariffs and Economic Agenda in Question
item.description: President Trump has used his sweeping global tariffs as an economic tool and a political cudgel. A decision invalidating them could hamper his power.

item.title: Democrats Won Big Because They Won Over Trump Supporters
item.description: It wasn’t just about superior turnout. Party switchers played a significant role in Virginia and New Jersey.

item.title: Canada Is About to Lose Its Status as Having Eliminated Measles
item.description: One province with an outsized number of cases has seen a collision of politics and public health policy.

item.title: Russia Close to Its Biggest Capture of a Ukrainian City Since 2023
item.description: The Kremlin is focusing its fire on Pokrovsk, a gateway to the Donetsk region, which Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, has long coveted.

item.title: Delta CEO Ed Bastian rejected a mentor’s advice for how to run the $38 billion airline: ‘He told me I’ll never have a moment of peace’
item.description: Delta CEO Ed Bastian says he reads through thousands of customer emails while flying in coach.

item.title: A Big Test for Trump’s Tariffs, and Major Cuts to Air Traffic
item.description: Plus, using A.I. to find a date.

item.title: Russia Close to Its Biggest Capture of a Ukrainian City Since 2023
item.description: The Kremlin is focusing its fire on Pokrovsk, a gateway to the Donetsk region, which Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, has long coveted.

item.title: Canada Is About to Lose Its Status as Having Eliminated Measles
item.description: One province with an outsized number of cases has seen a collision of politics and public health policy.

item.title: The U.S. Is Skipping This Year’s Climate Summit. For Many, That’s OK.
item.description: World leaders, gathering in Brazil, will try to agree on new, more ambitious plans to cut greenhouse gases.

item.title: COP30 U.N. Climate Talks Are Starting in Brazil. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: Diplomats and leaders from around the world are gathering on the edge of the Amazon rainforest for annual talks on how to limit global warming.

item.title: Students Find Hope at This Makeshift School in Gaza
item.description: In central Gaza, a makeshift school called Hope Makers is providing their young students, aged from five to twelve years old, psychological support to...
